properties.Description: Portrait of Horace "Horsecollar" Banks smoking a cigar and looking into the camera that was taken at Cardoza Playground in Washington, D.C. at 1st and I Streets SW with a house in the immediate background.  The caption on the photograph describes the winning streak of Randall Junior High School in military drill competitions in the late 1920s under the leadership of Banks, Ralph Tignor, and James Young.
properties.Title: Horace "Horsecollar" Banks
properties.Creator: Curtis, Joseph Owen, 1915-2005
properties.Source: Original version: 8 x 10 in. photograph; DC Public Library, Special Collections, Joseph Owen Curtis Photograph Collection, People
properties.Rights: Publication rights for this image can be granted by DC Public Library.
properties.Subject: City & town lifeSmokingRandall Junior High School (Washington, D.C.)

properties.Description: A group from a reunion of Southwest Washington, D.C.'s Randall Playground poses with food outside Bruce Wahl's Restaurant and Beer Garden after the father-son basketball game.  Identified members of the group include James Bruce, Connie, Elva Spriggs, Milton Jones, Mary Shorter, David Robinson, William Buchanan, "Willie Wildcat" James Wallace, Richard Stone, Bruce Wahl, David Cross Jr., Steve Wiggins, and Clarence Tuttle.  Caption describes the restaurant when it was Mike Wilson's in the 1930s.
properties.Title: After Randall Playground reunion game at Bruce Wahl's Restaurant and Beer Garden
properties.Creator: Curtis, Joseph Owen, 1915-2005
properties.Source: Original version: 8 x 10 in. photograph; DC Public Library, Special Collections, Joseph Owen Curtis Photograph Collection, Institutions and organizations - Randall Playground, Reunion
properties.Rights: Publication rights for this image can be granted by DC Public Library.
properties.Subject: ReunionsCity & town lifeBarsRandall Playground (Washington, D.C.)

properties.Description: 3rd Section of the Randall Junior High School Platoon of 9th grade cadets pose in line  at the 1st Annual Junior High School Drill, which they won, held at Randall playground in Washington D.C. Individual cadets are identified on the photograph.
